rev.comment: /* Scientology and psychiatry */ Added example for Hubbard's "old and flawed information regarding psychiatry"
/* Critical sites */ rearranged. Operation Clambake is the most notable and most famous critical site, it belongs on top.
/* Celebrity practitioners */
/* Critical sites */
/* Scientology as a commerical venture */ fixed references
/* Celebrity practitioners */
/* Silent birth and infant care */ added reference showing that honey is unsafe to give to children. Hopefully one such reference is enough. There are literally thousands we could add.
/* Silent birth and infant care */ This information is common knowledge. But we also have sources with his college coursework, and there is a citation for a doctor who repeats the claim at WebMD.
/* Tax-exempt status and status as a religion */ inserted para moved from intro
all this is summarised 2 paras up. Moved down to Criticism section to shorten intro
/* Silent birth and infant care */ unless this is a quote from a critic, this is editorial. (let's damn him with sourced facts).
/* Beliefs and practices */ their belief that humans evolved from clams isn't 'central' is it?
this just clutters the already too long intro
/* Auditing */
m copy
improved copy
spelling error for reasons
Please do not remove material from wikipedia. This information is properly sourced. If you want tons of sources explaining why babies shouldn't be provided with honey, we can provide them.
